title: 108_hr2472
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Budget Autonomy Act of 2003" amends Section 446 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act to address the enactment of the local budget. The Council must adopt the annual budget for the District of Columbia government within 50 days of receiving the proposal from the Mayor. Budget supplements must also be adopted after a public hearing. During control years, the Mayor submits the budget to the President for transmission to Congress after completing budget procedures outlined in the Act. Unauthorized obligations and expenditures by District of Columbia government officials are prohibited, except in specific circumstances. In the District of Columbia government, no funds can be spent without approval by the Council or Congress. Reprogramming of budget amounts requires approval by the Mayor and Council, with any additional spending offset by reductions elsewhere. Control years have specific budget procedures outlined in the Act. The Council approves reprogramming requests with offsetting expenditures. Control year defined in the Act. Congressional review period for budget acts amended. The Act will take effect after a 30-day period unless a joint resolution disapproving it is enacted within that time. If the 30-day period ends when Congress is not in session, the period is extended by 5 days. If a resolution disapproving the Act passes both Houses and becomes law, the Act is repealed. Upon passing both Houses of Congress and being transmitted to the President, a resolution will repeal the Act after a specified period. Various sections of the Act are amended to reflect these changes. The Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995 is amended in several sections by replacing references to specific sentences in section 446 with the appropriate subsections. Additionally, a clerical amendment is made to the table of contents of the Act. SEC. 446. Enactment of local budget. SEC. 3. Action by Council of District of Columbia on line-item vetoes by Mayor of provisions of budget acts. SEC. 4. Amendment to the District of Columbia Home Rule Act regarding the transmission of budget acts to the President and defining the term 'control year'. Permitting employees to be hired if the position is authorized by an Act of the Council. SEC. 4 amends the District of Columbia Home Rule Act to allow employees to be hired if the position is authorized by the Council. SEC. 5 includes other amendments related to changes in the federal budget process. SEC. 5 amends the District of Columbia Home Rule Act to restrict budget approval during control years in accordance with the financial plan established under the Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. SEC. 6 states that any general provision in an appropriation bill for Federal payments to the District of Columbia will remain in effect until the next fiscal year's appropriation bill is enacted. SEC. 7 specifies that the amendments in the Act apply to the District of Columbia's budgets starting from October 1, 2004.
